00080 /************** start of linux-camac.h ***********************/
00081 #ifndef _LINUX_CAMAC_H
00082 #define _LINUX_CAMAC_H
00083 
00084 #define Q_STOP          0
00085 #define Q_IGNORE        1
00086 #define Q_REPEAT        2
00087 #define Q_SCAN          3
00088 
00089 typedef unsigned long cdata_t;
00090 
00091 /* Structure for single camac command ioctl()s */
00092 typedef struct camac_t {
00093    cdata_t d;                   /* Data for read or write       */
00094    unsigned char n;             /* Device number                */
00095    unsigned char a;             /* Subaddress                   */
00096    unsigned char f;             /* Camac function               */
00097    unsigned int q;              /* Status flags                 */
00098    unsigned int x;
00099 } camac_t;
00100 
00101 /* Structure for single camac command ioctl()s */
00102 typedef struct camacblock_t {
00103    char *buffer;                /* Data for read or write       */
00104    size_t count;                /* Bytes to transfer            */
00105    unsigned int bits;           /* Bits per transfer word       */
00106    unsigned int type;           /* Block transfer type          */
00107    unsigned char n;             /* Device number                */
00108    unsigned char a;             /* Subaddress                   */
00109    unsigned char f;             /* Camac function               */
00110    int status;                  /* Return status of transfer    */
00111 } camacblock_t;
00112 
00113 /* Structures for camac command list processing */
00114 typedef struct camac_cmd_t {
00115    unsigned char n;
00116    unsigned char a;
00117    unsigned char f;
00118 } camac_cmd_t;
00119 
00120 typedef struct camaclist_t {
00121    int n;                       /* Number of commands in list   */
00122    camac_cmd_t *cmd;            /* Array of camac commands      */
00123    cdata_t *dbuf;               /* Data buffer for read/write   */
00124 } camaclist_t;
00125 
00126 /* The magic number for KCS ioctl codes
00127    - see /usr/src/linux/MAGIC & /usr/src/linux/include/asm/iotcl.h */
00128 #ifndef CAMAC_MAGIC
00129 #define CAMAC_MAGIC             'c'
00130 #endif
00131 
00132 /* Ioctl values - I'm using the ioctl numbering scheme described in
00133  * /usr/src/linux/MAGIC and /usr/src/linux/include/asm/ioctl.h */
00134 
00135 /* Generic ioctl codes to control data acquisition */
00136 #define CAMAC_INIT              _IO  ( CAMAC_MAGIC, 1 )
00137 #define CAMAC_CRATE_SELECT      _IO  ( CAMAC_MAGIC, 2 )
00138 #define CAMAC_ZCYCLE            _IO  ( CAMAC_MAGIC, 3 )
00139 #define CAMAC_CCYCLE            _IO  ( CAMAC_MAGIC, 4 )
00140 #define CAMAC_SETINH            _IO  ( CAMAC_MAGIC, 5 )
00141 #define CAMAC_CLRINH            _IO  ( CAMAC_MAGIC, 6 )
00142 #define CAMAC_EXEC              _IOWR( CAMAC_MAGIC, 7, camac_t )
00143 #define CAMAC_BLK_TRANSFER      _IOWR( CAMAC_MAGIC, 8, camacblock_t )
00144 #define CAMAC_STATUS            _IOWR( CAMAC_MAGIC, 9, camac_t )
00145 #define CAMAC_ENABLELAM         _IOW ( CAMAC_MAGIC, 10, camac_t )
00146 #define CAMAC_READ_LIST         _IOW ( CAMAC_MAGIC, 20, camaclist_t )
00147 #define CAMAC_WRITE_LIST        _IOW ( CAMAC_MAGIC, 21, camaclist_t )
00148 /*-PAA-*/
00149 #define CAMAC_LAM_READ          _IOWR( CAMAC_MAGIC, 22, camac_t  )
00150 #define CAMAC_LAM_ENABLE        _IOW ( CAMAC_MAGIC, 23, camac_t  )
00151 #define CAMAC_LAM_DISABLE       _IOW ( CAMAC_MAGIC, 24, camac_t  )
00152 #define CAMAC_LAM_CLEAR         _IOW ( CAMAC_MAGIC, 25, camac_t  )
00153 
00154 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00155 
00156 /* The timeout value while waiting for acknowledge from camac (seconds ) */
00157 #define CAMAC_TIMEOUT   1
00158 
00159 /* Static functions don't show up in ksyms - make external for debugging */
00160 #ifndef STATIC
00161 #define STATIC static
00162 #endif
00163 
00164 typedef struct CAMAC_t {
00165    int loaded;                  /* Is the device loaded         */
00166    int present;                 /* A card is present            */
00167    int open;                    /* The device is open           */
00168    int stat;                    /* Device status                */
00169    int dmaen;                   /* Enable DMA transfers         */
00170    int sharedma;                /* Share the DMA channel        */
00171    /* Data acquisition buffer */
00172    char *buffer;
00173    int bufsize;                 /* Size of buffers              */
00174    /* Device driver resources */
00175    int base;                    /* IO port base address         */
00176    int irq;                     /* Interrupt number             */
00177    int ownirq;                  /* Do we own the IRQ            */
00178    int dma;                     /* DMA channel                  */
00179    int owndma;                  /* Do we own the dma channel    */
00180    struct semaphore sem;        /* Semaphore to lock port access */
00181    struct wait_queue *wait_lam; /* Wait queue for LAM interrupts */
00182    struct wait_queue *wait_dma; /* Wait queue for blk transfers */
00183 } CAMAC_t;
00184 
00185 /* Functions to read and write to/from the card io ports */
00186 static inline void write_port(CAMAC_t * camac, unsigned char data, int port)
00187 {
00188    outb(data, camac->base + port);
00189 }
00190 
00191 static inline unsigned char read_port(CAMAC_t * camac, int port)
00192 {
00193    return inb(camac->base + port);
00194 }
00195 
00196 /* Functions to read and write to/from the card io ports in 16bit wide fmt */
00197 static inline void writew_port(CAMAC_t * camac, unsigned int data, int port)
00198 {
00199    outw((unsigned int) data, camac->base + port);
00200 }
00201 
00202 static inline unsigned int readw_port(CAMAC_t * camac, int port)
00203 {
00204    return inw(camac->base + port);
00205 }
00206 
00207 /* The functions which implement the camac functions */
00208 /* Each of these functions return non-zero on error */
00209 /*-PAA-*/
00210 int creadlam(CAMAC_t * camac, cdata_t * d);
00211 int cenalam(CAMAC_t * camac, int n);
00212 int cdislam(CAMAC_t * camac, int n);
00213 int cclearlam(CAMAC_t * camac, int n);
00214 
00215 int cselect(CAMAC_t * camac, int c);
00216 int cinit(CAMAC_t * camac);
00217 int zcycle(CAMAC_t * camac);
00218 int ccycle(CAMAC_t * camac);
00219 int setinh(CAMAC_t * camac);
00220 int clrinh(CAMAC_t * camac);
00221 void chkxq(CAMAC_t * camac, int *x, int *q);
00222 int cread(CAMAC_t * camac, unsigned char n, unsigned char a,
00223           unsigned char f, cdata_t * d);
00224 int cwrite(CAMAC_t * camac, unsigned char n, unsigned char a, unsigned char f, cdata_t d);
00225 int cexecute(CAMAC_t * camac, unsigned char n, unsigned char a, unsigned char f);
00226 int cblkstart(CAMAC_t * camac, int type, int bits, unsigned long nb);
00227 void cblkgo(CAMAC_t * camac, unsigned char n, unsigned char a, unsigned char f);
00228 void cblkend(CAMAC_t * camac);
00229 int cblkstatus(CAMAC_t * camac);
00230 int clamstatus(CAMAC_t * camac);

00237 
00238 /* verify_ioctl() checks `arg' is a valid data pointer for access
00239  * to user provided data.
00240  * This uses the ioctl numbering convention provided by the _IOXX macros
00241  * See /usr/include/asm/ioctl.h */
00242 extern inline int ioctl_verify(unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
00243 {
00244    int stat;
00245 
00246    if (cmd & IOC_IN) {
00247       stat = verify_area(VERIFY_READ, (void *) arg, _IOC_SIZE(cmd));
00248       if (stat)
00249          return stat;
00250    }
00251    if (cmd & IOC_OUT) {
00252       stat = verify_area(VERIFY_WRITE, (void *) arg, _IOC_SIZE(cmd));
00253       if (stat)
00254          return stat;
00255    }
00256    return 0;
00257 }
00258 
00259 #endif                          /* __KERNEL__ */
00260 
00261 #endif                          /* _LINUX_CAMAC_H */
00262 
00263 /************** end of linux-camac.h ***********************/
00264 char *lx_filename = DEVNAME;

00266 static int fd = -1;
00267 static char *fname = NULL;
00268 
00269 static void eprintf(const char *fmt, ...)
00270 {
00271    va_list ap;                  /* variable argument lists      */
00272 
00273    va_start(ap, fmt);
00274    vfprintf(stderr, fmt, ap);
00275    va_end(ap);
00276 }

00278 /* Select camac crate number `c' */
00279 INLINE int cselect(int c)
00280 {
00281    int stat;
00282 
00283    if ((stat = ioctl(fd, CAMAC_CRATE_SELECT, c)) != 0)
00284       perror(fname);
00285    return stat;
00286 }
00287 
00288 /*-input---------------------------------------------------------*/
00289 INLINE void cam16i(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, WORD * d)
00290 {
00291    cam24i(c, n, a, f, (DWORD *) d);
00292 }
00293 
00294 /*--input--------------------------------------------------------*/
00295 INLINE void cam24i(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, DWORD * d)
00296 {
00297    int stat;
00298    camac_t c_t;
00299 
00300    cselect(c);
00301    c_t.n = n;
00302    c_t.a = a;
00303    c_t.f = f;
00304 
00305    if ((stat = ioctl(fd, CAMAC_EXEC, &c_t)) != 0) {
00306       perror(fname);
00307    }
00308    *d = c_t.d;
00309 }
00310

00318 /*--input--------------------------------------------------------*/
00319 INLINE void cam24i_q(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, DWORD * d,
00320                      int *x, int *q)
00321 {
00322    int stat;
00323    camac_t c_t;
00324 
00325    cselect(c);
00326    c_t.n = n;
00327    c_t.a = a;
00328    c_t.f = f;
00329    if ((stat = ioctl(fd, CAMAC_EXEC, &c_t)) != 0) {
00330       perror(fname);
00331    }
00332    *d = c_t.d;
00333    *x = c_t.x;
00334    *q = c_t.q;
00335 }

00405 /*--output-------------------------------------------------------*/
00406 INLINE void cam24o(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, DWORD d)
00407 {
00408    int stat;
00409    camac_t c_t;
00410 
00411    cselect(c);
00412    c_t.n = n;
00413    c_t.a = a;
00414    c_t.f = f;
00415    c_t.d = d;
00416    if ((stat = ioctl(fd, CAMAC_EXEC, &c_t)) != 0) {
00417       perror(fname);
00418    }
00419 }
00420

00455 void cam16o_r(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, WORD * d, const int r)
00456 {
00457    INT i;
00458    for (i = 0; i < r; i++)
00459       cam16o(c, n, a, f, *d++);
00460 }

00502 /*--General functions--------------------------------------------*/
00503 INLINE int cam_init(void)
00504 {
00505    int stat;
00506 
00507    if (fd >= 0) {
00508       eprintf("copen(): `%s' already open: use cclose() to close\n", lx_filename);
00509       return -1;
00510    }
00511    fname = strdup(lx_filename);
00512    if ((fd = open(fname, O_RDWR)) < 0) {
00513       perror(fname);
00514       return fd;
00515    }
00516    if ((stat = ioctl(fd, CAMAC_INIT)) != 0)
00517       perror(fname);
00518    if (stat != 0)
00519       return -1;
00520 
00521    stat = cselect(0);
00522    printf("cselect for crate 0:%x\n", stat);
00523    return SUCCESS;
00524 }
00525 
00526 /*--General functions--------------------------------------------*/
00527 INLINE void cam_exit(void)
00528 {
00529    if (fd < 0) {
00530       eprintf("cclose(): No file open\n");
00531    }
00532    close(fd);
00533    fd = -1;
00534    if (fname)
00535       free(fname);
00536    fname = NULL;
00537 }
00538

00542    int stat;
00543 
00544    cselect(c);

00546       perror(fname);
00547 }

00586 {
00587    int stat;
00588    camac_t c_t;
00589 
00590    cselect(c);
00591    c_t.n = n;
00592    if ((stat = ioctl(fd, CAMAC_LAM_ENABLE, &c_t)) != 0) {
00593       perror(fname);
00594    }
00595 }
00596 
00597 /*--General functions--------------------------------------------*/
00598 INLINE void cam_lam_disable(const int c, const int n)
00599 {
00600    int stat;
00601    camac_t c_t;
00602 
00603    /* see comment in cam_lam_enable */
00604    cselect(c);
00605    c_t.n = n;
00606    if ((stat = ioctl(fd, CAMAC_LAM_DISABLE, &c_t)) != 0) {
00607       perror(fname);
00608    }
00609 }

00693 int cwritelist(camaclist_t * clist)
00694 {
00695    int stat;
00696 
00697    if ((stat = ioctl(fd, CAMAC_WRITE_LIST, clist)) != 0) {
00698       perror(fname);
00699       return stat;
00700    }
00701    return 0;
00702 }
00703 
00704 int creadlist(camaclist_t * clist)
00705 {
00706    int stat;
00707 
00708    if ((stat = ioctl(fd, CAMAC_READ_LIST, clist)) != 0) {
00709       perror(fname);
00710       return stat;
00711    }
00712    return 0;
00713 }
00714 
00715 int cblock(int n, int a, int f, int mode, int bits, void *buffer, long *count)
00716 {
00717    camacblock_t cblock;
00718    int stat;
00719 
00720    cblock.buffer = buffer;
00721    cblock.count = *count;
00722    cblock.n = n;
00723    cblock.a = a;
00724    cblock.f = f;
00725    cblock.bits = bits;
00726    cblock.type = mode;
00727    cblock.status = 0;
00728    if ((stat = ioctl(fd, CAMAC_BLK_TRANSFER, &cblock)) != 0) {
00729       perror(fname);
00730       return stat;
00731    }
00732    *count = cblock.count;
00733    return 0;
00734 }

00740    *q = *x = 1;
